text: Regulation of low shear flow - induced HAEC <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and monocyte adhesion .

text: We recently reported that prolonged exposure of human aortic endothelial cells ( HAEC ) to low shear stress flow patterns is associated with a sustained increase in the activated form of the transcriptional regulator nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) .

Here we investigate the hypothesis that low shear - induced activation of NF-kappaB is responsible for enhanced expression of <extra_id_0> vascular cell adhesion molecule <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) resulting in augmented endothelial cell-monocyte ( EC-Mn ) adhesion and that this activation is dependent on intracellular oxidant activity .

text: Before exposure to low shear ( 2 dyn / cm2 ) for 6 h , HAEC were preincubated with or without the antioxidants pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( PDTC ) or N - acetyl-L-cysteine ( NAC ) .
PDTC strongly inhibited low shear - induced activation of NF-kappaB , expression of <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and EC-Mn adhesion .

text: Paradoxically , NAC exerted a positive effect on low shear - induced <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and EC-Mn adhesion and only slightly downregulated NF-kappaB activation .

text: However , cytokine - induced NF-kappaB activation and <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression are blocked by both PDTC and NAC .

text: These data suggest that NF-kappaB plays a key role in low shear - induced <extra_id_0> VCAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression and that pathways mediating low shear - and cytokine - induced EC-Mn adhesion may be differentially regulated .
